main.tree_interpreter module¶

class main.tree_interpreter.TreeInterpreter(model, examples, joint_contribution=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

predict()[source]¶

Returns a triple (prediction, bias, feature_contributions), such that prediction ≈ bias + feature_contributions.

Returns

  • decomposed prediction (triple of)

  • * prediction, shape = (n_samples) for regression and (n_samples, n_classes) – for classification

  • * bias, shape = (n_samples) for regression and (n_samples, n_classes) for – classification

  • * contributions, If joint_contribution is False then returns and array of – shape = (n_samples, n_features) for regression or shape = (n_samples, n_features, n_classes) for classification, denoting contribution from each feature. If joint_contribution is True, then shape is array of size n_samples, where each array element is a dict from a tuple of feature indices to to a value denoting the contribution from that feature tuple.

predict_forest()[source]¶

For a given RandomForestRegressor, RandomForestClassifier, ExtraTreesRegressor, or ExtraTreesClassifier returns a triple of [prediction, bias and feature_contributions], such that prediction ≈ bias + feature_contributions.

predict_tree(tree)[source]¶

For a given DecisionTreeRegressor, DecisionTreeClassifier, ExtraTreeRegressor, or ExtraTreeClassifier, returns a triple of [prediction, bias and feature_contributions], such that prediction ≈ bias + feature_contributions.
